bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Dorma V. Schnurr to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1947

div1.p: Schnurr sends Hench a bill for secretarial services connected with transcriptions of a Reed interview.

div1.head: Letter from Dorma V. Schnurr to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1947
div1.opener:
1616 - 16th St. N. W.
Washington, D. C.
January 27, 1947
Dr. P. S. Hench
517 Fourth St. S. W.
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Yesterday, by registered mail I sent to you four copies of the
revised Reed interview, and also the copy edited by General Reed. By
the same post, I sent one copy of this final draft to General Reed
and one to Mrs. Blossom Reed. I believe this was what you wished me
to do.

I am sorry I couldn't get this to you sooner, but I got the
prevailing flu almost the minute I returned (must've been the Minnesota
variety!) and was out of work for several days, so I really have had
a time getting caught up with things.

The following is an itemized statement of the expenses involved:
Transcription (29 hours)$29.00
Paper3.10
Postage and registry fees1.31
Taxi1.00
__________
$ 34.41

I have a couple or three more copies of the original Reed version.
If you would care to have these, and perhaps have someone make the
corrections on them, I will be glad to send them on to you.
Best wishes to you and Mrs. Hench, also to Rose.
